answers.answer: Ukrainian preschoolers, pupils, and students from Ukraine located in Romania have the right to education, ensured by rapid crisis management measures approved by the authorities.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'My rights'.

answers.answer: To enroll a child in school, contact the County Schools Inspectorates, fill out the application with the audiences statute, submit it for analysis, and then a commission will contact you regarding placement.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'I want to enroll my child in school'.

answers.answer: To enroll a child in extracurricular activities, contact the County Schools Inspectorates, fill out and submit the application without needing audience status, and a commission will analyze it and assign a group/class.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'I want to enroll my child in extracurricular activities'.

answers.answer: Children can benefit from psycho-pedagogical assistance and counseling by checking that option on the application form when enrolling in school or extracurricular activities.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'How to enroll a child in school, kindergarten or extracurricular activities'.

answers.answer: For Ukrainian children who want to learn Romanian, the County School Inspectorates will create the necessary conditions and assure appropriate human resources for the request.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'How to enroll a child in school, kindergarten or extracurricular activities'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian students can continue their studies by going directly to the university they wish to attend; enrollment is possible based on a statement of responsibility regarding previous studies, even without formal documents, though each university has its own procedure.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'Continuing your studies'.

answers.answer: The process involves setting up a file with required documents, submitting it online, physically, or by mail, and then collecting the certificate of recognition from CNRED headquarters, the university, or electronically.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'I have completed my studies'.

answers.answer: Diploma recognition results will be available within a maximum of 30 working days from the complete file's registration date, though this deadline may be extended if further checks are required.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'I have completed my studies'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian minors under temporary protection are eligible for free accommodation in school dormitories, a daily food allowance, and additional financial support for school supplies, bedding, clothing, and footwear.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'Accommodation and Allowances for Ukrainian Minors'.

answers.answer: For inquiries regarding the enrollment and integration process, Ukrainian students can contact Maricica Ciubara, the advisor for Ukrainian students at the Bucharest School Inspectorate (ISMB), at +40799626330.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'Assistance in the integration of Ukrainian children into the Romanian education system'.

answers.answer: Useful information is available about Ukrainian online kindergartens, part-time kindergartens, Ukrainian schools and classes in various Romanian cities, remote education options, and free education in private schools in Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'Ukrainian schools and kindergartens in Romania'.

answers.answer: Free courses and activities for adults and children from Ukraine are available in Romania, including language courses, yoga, drawing classes, chess, and music.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'Courses and activities for refugees from Ukraine'.

answers.answer: A calendar providing a list of days off in Romanian educational institutions and the structure of the 2024-2025 school year is available.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'Calendar of holidays in schools and kindergartens in Romania'.

answers.answer: You can contact the County Schools Inspectorates by checking the provided list with contact information for all of them in Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'How to enroll a child in school, kindergarten or extracurricular activities'.

answers.answer: To obtain a certificate of recognition of studies, you need an application (if physical), a copy of your high school diploma/certificate, school situation for the last two years, personal identification documents, and an evaluation fee (unless exempt).
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/education and read the section under 'I have completed my studies'.
